data.enText: objects that can be moved, such as tables, chairs and beds, that are put into a house or an office to make it suitable for living or working in
We need to buy some new furniture.
data.chText: 我们需要买一些新家具。

data.enText: a person or thing that you are so used to seeing that you no longer notice them
data.chText: 见惯了的人（或东西）；存在已久故不为人注意的人（或事物）

data.enText: I worked there so long that I became part of the furniture.
data.chText: 我在那里工作得太久，都不为人注意了。

data.enText: a person or thing that you are so used to seeing that you no longer notice them
data.chText: 见惯了的人（或东西）；存在已久故不为人注意的人（或事物）

data.enText: I worked there so long that I became part of the furniture.
data.chText: 我在那里工作得太久，都不为人注意了。

tr: furnishings that make a room or other area ready for occupancy
example: they had too much furniture for the small apartment
there was only one piece of furniture in the room

example.ex: Each piece of furniture in their home suited the style of the house.
example.tran: 他们家里的每件家具都和房子的风格相得益彰。

value.def: Furniture consists of large objects such as tables, chairs, or beds that are used in a room for sitting or lying on or for putting things on or in.

If you describe someone or something as part of the furniture, you are suggesting that they have been somewhere such as their place of work for such a long time that it is hard to imagine that place without them.
value.tran: 被认作当然的人(或事物);习以为常的人(或事物)

value.boxu_tran: furniture 只能用作不可数名词。不能说 a furniture 或 furnitures。将桌、椅、床等泛称为家具时，可以说 a piece of furniture 或 an item of furniture。
value.boxu_usage: Note that furniture is only ever used as an uncount noun. You cannot say 'a furniture' or 'furnitures'. If you want to refer in general terms to something such as a table, a chair, or a bed, you can say a piece of furniture or an item of furniture.
